properties.Name: Thian Hock Keng Temple, Singapore
properties.description: Thian Hock Keng Temple is the oldest Chinese temple in Singapore and dedicated to Mazu, the Goddess of the Sea.
properties.Image Text: The Thian Hock Keng Temple in Singapore is dedicated to Mazu, the Goddess of the Sea.

properties.Name: Eurasian Heritage Centre: Singapore Attraction
properties.description: This engaging heritage attraction takes you through the history and culture of the Eurasian community in Singapore.
properties.Opening Hours: Tuesday to Sunday, 9am – 6pm, Closed on Monday
properties.Image Text: Discover the history and culture of the Eurasian community in Singapore.

properties.Name: Shophouses
properties.description: Few buildings epitomise our culture as fully as the shophouse, with its surprisingly harmonious mix of diverse design elements.
properties.Image Text: The varying styles of Singapore's shophouses are a showcase of our evolving architecture.

properties.Name: Pinnacle@Duxton
properties.description: With its lofty towers and dizzying sky gardens, the Pinnacle at Duxton takes residential living to soaring new heights.
properties.Image Text: The Pinnacle@Duxton's architecture is a refreshing change in a sea of concrete blocks.

properties.Name: Haw Par Villa: Singapore Theme Park
properties.description: A visit to the Haw Par Villa theme park is an unforgettable journey into Chinese folklore and mythology.

properties.Name: Hong San See Temple Singapore
properties.description: Dancing dragons and prancing phoenixes are just some of the visual delights to catch at the exquisitely restored Hong San See temple.

properties.Name: Capitol Building Singapore
properties.description: Now undergoing massive restoration works, Capitol Building will emerge as Singapore’s premier entertainment hub next year.
properties.Image Text: The Capitol Building's distinctive facade adds a touch of grandeur to the cityscape.

properties.Name: The Interlace
properties.description: Few buildings demonstrate out-of-the-box thinking as well as The Interlace, an intriguingly designed residential complex.

properties.Name: Lasalle College of the Arts
properties.description: Lasalle College of the Arts evokes awe with its bold, graphic lines and stunning reinterpretation of nature.
properties.Opening Hours: Administration Office, Monday to Friday, 9am to 6pm. Visitors can still walk around the campus after office opening hours
properties.Image Text: Lasalle College of the Arts pushes the boundaries of creativity in architecture

properties.Name: SIT Flats Singapore
properties.description: The Art Deco elegance of the flats in Tiong Bahru speak of the richness of a vanished world.
properties.ADDRESSSTREETNAME: Seng Poh Road and Tiong Bahru Road
properties.Image Text: The charm of Tiong Bahru comes to life through its Art Deco architecture.

properties.Name: Lau Pa Sat Singapore
properties.description: The historic market Lau Pa Sat offers a winning combination of graceful colonial architecture, a longstanding heritage and delicious food.
properties.Image Text: Lau Pa Sat blends graceful colonial architecture, heritage and delicious food.

properties.Name: Peranakan Museum Singapore: History & Culture
properties.description: At the Peranakan Museum, get to know Singapore’s vibrant Peranakan community and its eclectic culture and history with fun and interactive exhibits.
properties.Image Text: Many communities, one nation. Find out more about our people, such as the ubiquitous Peranakans.

properties.Name: Gillman Barracks – YourSingapore
properties.description: Gillman Barracks Singapore is Asia’s vibrant new destination for the creation, exhibition and discussion of contemporary art.
properties.Opening Hours: Tuesday to Saturday, 11am - 7pm, Sunday, 11am - 6pm , Galleries closed on Monday and public holidays.

properties.Name: National Museum of Singapore
properties.description: The National Museum of Singapore is a progressive showcase of the country’s history and culture.
properties.Opening Hours: Singapore History Gallery Daily, 10am – 6pm,Last admission at 5.30pm.Singapore Living Galleries Daily, 10am – 8pm Free admission from 6pm –8pm , Last admission at 7.30pm
properties.Image Text: The National Museum of Singapore building is also an architectural icon that is stunning to behold.

properties.Name: The Japanese Cemetery Park
properties.description: The Japanese Cemetery Park is the largest Japanese cemetery in Southeast Asia, containing nearly 1,000 graves of Singapore’s early Japanese community.
properties.Image Text: The Japanese Cemetery Park holds the ashes of thousands of Japanese soldiers, marines and airmen killed during World War II.

properties.Name: Singapore Philatelic Museum
properties.description: The Philatelic Museum offers visitors postage stamp-sized windows into Singapore and the rest of the world.
properties.Image Text: Take a colourful trip back in time at this Singapore museum dedicated to postage stamps and related materials.

properties.Name: Lim Bo Seng Memorial
properties.description: The gazetted Lim Bo Seng Memorial at Esplanade Park commemorates one of Singapore’s heroes from World War II.
properties.Image Text: The Lim Bo Seng Memorial commemorates one of Singapore's heroes from World War II.

properties.Name: Kranji War Memorial Landmark in Singapore
properties.description: The Kranji War Memorial in Singapore honours the men and women from the Commonwealth who died in the line of duty during World War II.
properties.Image Text: The serene Kranji War Memorial, Singapore is a hillside cemetery set in a quiet neighbourhood.

properties.Name: The Cenotaph - a Singapore War Memorial Landmark
properties.description: The Cenotaph in Singapore is a war memorial in Esplanade Park that honours the heroes who fought and died during World War I and World War II.
properties.Image Text: Surrounded by lush green, The Cenotaph sits at a quiet spot amid the city buzz.

properties.Name: The Civilian War Memorial park in Singapore
properties.description: The Civilian War Memorial and park in Beach Road commemorates Singapore’s civilian victims of the Japanese Occupation during World War II.
properties.ADDRESSSTREETNAME: Bras Basah Road & Beach Road intersection

properties.Name: Maghain Aboth Synagogue
properties.description: The simple exterior of the Maghain Aboth Synagogue gives no indication of its richly elegant interiors.
properties.Opening Hours: Visits are available only by appointment. For more information, email jewishwb@singnet.com.sg or call +65 6337 2189 (ext. 103)

properties.Name: Sri Mariamman Temple: Hindu Temple in Singapore
properties.description: Sri Mariamman Temple, located in Chinatown, is the oldest Hindu temple in Singapore.
properties.Image Text: Sri Mariamman Temple's ornate and elaborate detailing makes it a wonder to behold.

properties.Name: Armenian Church in Singapore
properties.description: The Armenian Church is the oldest Christian church in Singapore and an architectural masterpiece from the early 19th century.
properties.Image Text: The Armenian Church in Singapore is a 19th-century architectural masterpiece.

properties.Name: CHIJMES Singapore
properties.description: Who would have thought a former school would make such a graceful transition? As a lifestyle and entertainment complex, CHIJMES soars high above the rest.
properties.Opening Hours: Daily, 24 hours,Opening hours of businesses in CHIJMES may vary.
properties.Image Text: The charm of CHIJMES, Singapore harks back to a bygone, gracious age.

properties.Name: St Andrew’s Cathedral- Singapore Architecture Landmark
properties.description: St Andrew's Cathedral is Singapore's largest cathedral and a stellar example of colonial-era architecture and heritage.
properties.Image Text: Singapore's largest cathedral is worth a visit for its architectural beauty.

properties.Name: Old Ford Factory Singapore Museum
properties.description: The Old Ford Factory is a repository of memories about the hardships endured during the Japanese Occupation of Singapore.
properties.Image Text: The site of the first Ford plant in Southeast Asia, the Old Ford Factory in Singapore is a journey to the past.

properties.Name: Singapore Coins and Notes Museum & Museum Singapore
properties.description: The Singapore Coins and Notes Museum tells the story of Singapore through the currencies it has used over the years.
properties.Image Text: Explore the city of Singapore through its coins and notes over the years at the Singapore Coins and Notes Museum.

properties.Name: Singapore City Gallery
properties.description: The Singapore City Gallery tells the story of the city’s physical transformation.

properties.Name: Chinese Heritage Centre, Singapore
properties.description: The Chinese Heritage Centre in Singapore is where you can find out more about overseas Chinese communities and their culture.
properties.Opening Hours: Monday to Friday, 9.30am – 5pm,Saturday and Sunday, 10am –5pm, Closed on public holidays
properties.Image Text: Explore questions on ethnic identity such as what it means to be a Chinese.

properties.Name: Kampong Glam & Malay Culture in Singapore
properties.description: Discover the heart of Singapore’s Malay community, living traditions, excellent eateries and trendy shops in vibrant Kampong Glam.
properties.Image Text: Delve into Malay culture at the heart of its community, Kampong Glam Singapore.

properties.Name: Contemporary Arts Center
properties.description: The Contemporary Arts Center at the Nanyang Technological University uses a variety of medium to explore contemporary art.
properties.Opening Hours: Tuesday to Sunday, 12pm – 7pm Friday, 12pm – 9pm , Closed on Monday. Open on public holiday.
properties.Image Text: The Contemporary Arts Center hosts exhibitions, live performances, film screenings and talks by visiting artists and curators.

properties.Name: The Substation, Singapore Contemporary Art Centre
properties.description: The Substation is an experimental arts centre that gives a space for contemporary artists to try out new concepts.
properties.Opening Hours: The Substation Box Office ,Monday to Friday, 12pm - 2pm and 5pm - 8pm.Saturday and Sunday, open an hour prior to weekend showtimes. Closed on public holidays.The Substation Gallery Daily, 12pm – 9pm Closed on public holidays

properties.Name: Singapore Art Museum
properties.description: The Singapore Art Museum houses the world’s largest public collection of contemporary Southeast Asian artworks.
properties.Image Text: Get to know the works of contemporary artists around Southeast Asia at the Singapore Art Museum.

properties.Name: Esplanade Theatres on the Bay
properties.description: Esplanade Theatres on the Bay is the country’s premier arts centre as well as an iconic landmark on the city’s skyline.
properties.Opening Hours: Box Office Opening Hours Daily, 12pm – 8.30pm, The Esplanade Box Office will open 1 hour prior to show commencement for shows before 12 noon and will remain open up to half an hour after show commencement for shows starting after 8.30pm.
properties.Image Text: Get your dose of creativity at Esplanade Theatres on the Bay, Singapore's premier arts centre.
properties.Image By: Mori Hidetaka, Courtesy of Esplanade – Theatres on the Bay

properties.Name: National Design Centre, Singapore
properties.description: The National Design Centre is a design lover’s dream destination.
properties.Image Text: Explore the wonderful world of design at the National Design Centre, Singapore.

properties.Name: Victoria Theatre Singapore
properties.description: The historic Victoria Theatre and Concert Hall has been transformed to meet the needs of a modern audience.
properties.Image Text: Catch world-class performances at stunning venues, like The Victoria Theatre and Concert Hall.

properties.Name: Sun Yat Sen Memorial Hall
properties.description: The Sun Yat Sen Memorial Hall is a fitting tribute to the intriguing life and times of Chinese revolutionary leader Dr Sun Yat Sen.
properties.Opening Hours: Tuesday to Sunday, 10am – 5pm, Closed on Monday
properties.Image Text: The Sun Yat Sen Memorial Hall pays tribute to the revolutionary leader.

properties.Name: Asian Civilisations Museum & Singapore Museum
properties.description: Housed in a historical building by the Singapore River, this museum is a microcosm of Asian civilisations spread over 11 galleries.
properties.Image Text: The Asian Civilizations Museum, Singapore is a historic building that tells the story of Asian civilisation.

properties.Name: Singapore Botanic Gardens
properties.description: Singapore’s Botanic Gardens is a treasure trove for plant lovers, or those who simply want to have a good time outdoors.
properties.Opening Hours: Singapore Botanic Gardens Daily, 5am - 12am National Orchid Garden Daily, 8.30am - 7pm(last ticket sales at 6pm)Jacob Ballas Children's Garden Tuesday to Sunday, 8am - 7pm(last admission: 6.30pm)Closed every Monday (except when it falls on a designated public holiday)SBG Heritage MuseumDaily*, 9am - 6pm*Closed every last Monday of the month (except when it falls on a designated public holiday, it will be closed the following day)

properties.Name: Singapore Zoo: Attractions & Things to Do
properties.description: Catch animals in their natural habitats at the award-winning Singapore Zoo.
properties.Image Text: The award-winning Singapore Zoo lets you see your favourite animals in all their natural wonder.

properties.Name: Cable Car Singapore & Mount Faber
properties.description: Getting to the hilltop dining and entertainment spot at Mount Faber by cable car is half the fun.
properties.Image Text: Spend a unique evening overlooking spectacular views on a cable car in Singapore's Mount Faber.

properties.Name: Night Safari, Singapore
properties.description: Head to the Night Safari for an after dark visit to the weird and wonderful creatures of the night.
properties.Opening Hours: Daily, 7.30pm - 12am .Last ticket sale at 11.15pm.F and B and retail outlets open from 5.30pm
properties.Image Text: Enter a world of nocturnal creatures at the Night Safari, Singapore.

properties.Name: Pulau Ubin & Singapore Islands
properties.description: Hop on a bumboat to the island of Pulau Ubin if you want a taste of nature and rustic village life, away from the hustle and bustle of Singapore.

properties.Name: MacRitchie Singapore & Singapore Nature Reserve
properties.description: The attractions around MacRitchie Reservoir caters to fitness fanatics, water sports enthusiasts and nature lovers.
properties.Image Text: MacRitchie Reservoir is nature’s playground for those who love the great outdoors.

properties.Name: Civic District, Singapore
properties.description: The Civic District is where Singapore’s historical, architectural and cultural heritage starts.
properties.Image Text: Immerse yourself in a day of history and culture at the Civic District, Singapore.

properties.Name: HarbourFront, Singapore
properties.description: HarbourFront is the place to go if you're hopping on a cruise from Singapore, taking a ferry to the outlying islands or simply want to eat, shop or relax.
properties.Image Text: HarbourFront, Singapore is your exciting gateway to entertainment and Singapore's outlying islands.

properties.Name: SAM at 8Q & Singapore Art Museum
properties.description: SAM at 8Q at the Singapore Art Museum showcases the works of Singapore contemporary artists.
properties.Image Text: SAM at 8Q is the funkier sister of the Singapore Art Museum.

properties.Name: Jamae Mosque (Masjid Chulia) Singapore
properties.description: Jamae Mosque (or Masjid Chulia) is one of Singapore’s oldest mosques and a prominent landmark in Chinatown since the 1820s.
properties.Image Text: The Jamae Mosque in Singapore is one of the oldest mosques in Singapore.

properties.Name: Institute of Contemporary Arts Singapore
properties.description: Housed in a tertiary arts college, the Institute of Contemporary Arts Singapore will help you deepen your appreciation for experimental artworks.
properties.Opening Hours: Tuesday to Sunday, 12pm - 7pm, Closed on Monday and public holidays
properties.ADDRESSSTREETNAME: LASALLE College of the Arts, 1 McNally Street
properties.Image Text: Be inspired by the architecture and creativity at the Institute of Contemporary Arts, Singapore.

properties.Name: Singapore Flyer
properties.description: The Singapore Flyer not only offers you stunning views of the city, but is one of the city’s most recognisable architectural icons.
properties.Image Text: Marvel at spectacular panoramas of the city skyline from the Singapore Flyer.

properties.Name: Marina Barrage
properties.description: The Marina Barrage not only supplies water to Singaporeans and helps alleviate floods but also doubles up as a place for family fun.
properties.Opening Hours: Marina Barrage - All day  Information Counter Daily, 9am – 9pm
properties.Image Text: More than just an ordinary dam, the Marina Barrage is an ideal recreational space.

properties.Name: Henderson Waves Bridge
properties.description: With the Henderson Waves bridge, form meets function to stunning effect.
properties.Image Text: Explore some of the city’s best parks and trails, such as the Southern Ridges Walk.

properties.Name: Marina Bay Singapore: Attractions & Things to do
properties.description: Marina Bay represents all things modern and super-stylish in Singapore, from trendy dining destinations to fun leisure spots.
properties.Image Text: Marina Bay Sands® is an integrated resort with experiences like no other.

properties.Name: Chek Jawa
properties.description: A world away from shopping malls and glitzy hotels, the natural wonder of Chek Jawa is one of Singapore’s richest eco-systems.
properties.Image Text: Bird lovers can spot rare species from a 21-metre tall viewing tower at Chek Jawa.

properties.Name: Merlion Park, Singapore: Attractions & Things to Do
properties.description: Merlion Park houses a Singapore icon that is half-fish and half-lion, and famous throughout the world.
properties.Image Text: Come and see the Singapore icon that is half-fish and half-lion at the Merlion Park.

properties.Name: Marina Bay Sands® SkyPark
properties.description: The Marina Bay Sands<sup>®</sup> SkyPark is a roof like no other, perched 200 metres in the air with an infinity pool and observation deck in the clouds.
properties.Image Text: Take in stunning views from an infinity pool and observation deck in the clouds at the Marina Bay Sands SkyPark.

properties.Name: Resorts World Sentosa, Singapore
properties.description: Whether it’s themes parks, world-class performances or celebrity restaurants, you’ll never run out of things to do at Resorts World™ Sentosa.
properties.Opening Hours: Opening hours differ for the various attractions.
properties.Image Text: From world-class theme parks to celebrity restaurants, Resorts World Sentosa has it all.

properties.Name: Sungei Buloh
properties.description: The ecological wonder of Sungei Buloh will transport you into a world rich in animal and plant life.
properties.Image Text: Get up close with a wide variety of flora and fauna in their natural habitat at this Singapore Garden.

properties.Name: S.E.A. Aquarium
properties.description: Immerse yourself underwater at the S.E.A. Aquarium™ and take a look into the planet’s largest window to the ocean.
properties.Opening Hours: Open daily at 10am.Closing time varies. Please visit the official website for more information.
properties.Image Text: Explore a world rich with animal and plant life at the Sungei Buloh Wetland Reserve.

properties.Name: Singapore River: History & Culture Tours
properties.description: Get to know the historic Singapore River and its famous quays: Boat Quay, Clarke Quay and Robertson Quay. This, after all, is where it all began.
properties.Image Text: Take a stroll along the Singapore River and see how the city came to be.

properties.Name: Chinatown Singapore: History & Culture
properties.description: Singapore’s legendary Chinatown is a bustling mix of old and new, filled with traditional shops and night markets as well as cool stores and cafes.
properties.Image Text: Chinatown, Singapore is a bustling mix of old-world charm and modern delights.

properties.Name: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple & Museum in Singapore
properties.description: The Buddha Tooth Relic Temple & Museum is a Tang-styled Chinese Buddhist temple in Chinatown that gets its name from the Sacred Buddha Tooth Relic.

properties.Name: National Gallery Singapore
properties.description: Take in the region’s newest and largest museum of modern Singapore and Southeast Asian art housed within two of Singapore’s awe-inspiring national monuments.
properties.Opening Hours: Effective from 24 November 2015, Sunday to Thursday and  public holidays,10am - 7pm ,Friday to Saturday and  eve of public holidays, 10am - 10pm

properties.Name: Universal Studios Singapore™ Theme Park
properties.description: Universal Studios Singapore™ at Resorts World™ Sentosa is a movie-themed entertainment park that the whole family can enjoy.
properties.Opening Hours: Open daily at 10am.Closing time varies. Please visit the official website for more information.
properties.Image Text: Southeast Asia's first Hollywood movie theme park offers a dizzying selection of entertainment offerings.

properties.Name: Fuk Tak Chi Museum & Places of Interest
properties.description: Fuk Tak Chi Museum was once the oldest Chinese temple in Singapore and is an elegant example of restored architecture in Chinatown.
properties.Image Text: Marvel at the Fuk Tak Chi Museum's carefully restored architecture in the heart of Chinatown.

properties.Name: Katong Antique House Singapore: Peranakan Heritage
properties.description: Step into this fully restored bona fide Peranakan family home, and admire the many antiques and heirlooms worthy of any museum collection.
properties.Image Text: Marvel at antiques and heirlooms worthy of any museum collection at the Katong Antique House.

properties.Name: Chinese Garden Singapore
properties.description: A tranquil patch of imperial China in the west of Singapore is pleasant respite from the bustle of the city.
properties.Image Text: Step back in time to ancient China at the beautiful Chinese Garden, Singapore.

properties.Name: East Coast Park Singapore
properties.description: With so many attractions packed into the 15-km stretch of beaches at East Coast Park, you’ll never run out of things to do.
properties.ADDRESSSTREETNAME: Along East Coast Parkway and East Coast Park Service Road
properties.Image Text: Whether you prefer water sports, rollerblading or cycling, find a myriad of things to do at East Coast Park, Singapore.

properties.Name: Kusu Island, Singapore
properties.description: Kusu Island lies to the south of Singapore, and has a wonderful mix of local heritage and beach activities.

properties.Name: HortPark
properties.description: HortPark is a gorgeous collection of stunning gardens and plants that will make you  forget about the bustle of city.
properties.Image Text: Escape the buzz of the city at HortPark, Singapore.

properties.Name: Adventure Cove Waterpark™ Singapore
properties.description: Adventure Cove Waterpark™ Singapore at Resorts World™ Sentosa promises a day of wet and wild fun in the sun.
properties.Image Text: Adventure Cove Waterpark™, Singapore is the perfect place to have fun with loved ones.

properties.Name: Chinatown Heritage Centre, Singapore
properties.description: At the Chinatown Heritage Centre, experience how Singapore’s early Chinese migrants once lived and learn more about local Chinese culture.
properties.Opening Hours: Daily, 9am – 8pm,Last entry at 7pm.*Chinatown Heritage Centre will be closed for renovation from 1 October 2014 till end-2015.
properties.Image Text: Learn more about local Chinese culture at the Singapore Chinatown Heritage Centre.

properties.Name: Hajjah Fatimah Mosque
properties.description: With its tilting European-style minaret and Chinese tiling, the Hajjah Fatimah Mosque is one of the most unique mosques in Singapore.
properties.Image Text: The Hajjah Fatimah Mosque in Singapore features an intriguing blend of cross-cultural architectural influences.

properties.Name: NUS Baba House - Singapore Peranakan Architecture
properties.description: NUS Baba House is a heritage house that gives a rich look at Singapore's Peranakan community, thanks to beautifully preserved architecture and artefacts.
properties.Opening Hours: Visits are by appointment only.Visitors must sign up in advance for heritage tours which fall on:Monday, 2pm – 3pm,Tuesday, 6.30pm – 7.30pm,Thursday, 10am – 11am,Saturday, 11am – 12pm
properties.Image Text: Beautifully preserved architecture and artefacts make the NUS Baba House a must-visit.

properties.Name: Esplanade Theatre
properties.description: The Esplanade is boldly designed performing arts centre that has become a memorable part of Singapore’s skyline.
properties.Image Text: Catch a world-class opera or pop concert at Singapore’s premier performing arts centre.

properties.Name: PARKROYAL on Pickering
properties.description: PARKROYAL on Pickering is a luxurious garden oasis in downtown Singapore.
properties.Image Text: Pamper yourself and save the world at the same time at PARKROYAL on Pickering.

properties.Name: Old Supreme Court Singapore
properties.description: Due to reopen as the National Gallery Singapore, the Old Supreme Court is in itself a masterpiece of classical art.
properties.Image Text: The Old Supreme Court lends a stately presence to the heart of Singapore city.

properties.Name: Malay Heritage Centre, Singapore
properties.description: The Malay Heritage Centre is a must-visit if you’re keen on learning about the rich heritage and culture of Singapore’s Malay community.
properties.Opening Hours: Malay Heritage Centre Museum, Tuesday to Sunday, 10am – 6pm, Closed on Monday, Malay Heritage Centre Compound, Tuesday to Sunday, 8am – 8pm, Friday and Saturday, 8am – 10pm, Closed on Monday
properties.Image Text: Delve into the rich heritage and culture of Singapore’s Malay community.

properties.Name: Raffles Singapore
properties.description: Sip a Singapore Sling beneath the whirling fans at the Long Bar, and let the tranquil charms of Raffles Singapore bring you back into another era.
properties.Image Text: The iconic Raffles Hotel has been home to both tall tales and famous folks.

properties.Name: Dalhousie Obelisk, a Singapore Landmark
properties.description: Dalhousie Obelisk at Empress Place is a famous architectural landmark in Singapore.
properties.Image Text: The Dalhousie Obelisk is a historically significant piece of Singapore architecture.

properties.Name: Raffles Statue – Sir Stamford Raffles Landing Site
properties.description: Raffles Statue depicts the founder of modern Singapore, Sir Stamford Raffles. Two statues exist today, at the Raffles Landing Site and Empress Place.

properties.Name: Indian National Army (INA) Monument in Singapore
properties.description: The Indian National Army (INA) Monument at Esplanade Park is a memorial that was built in 1995 to mark the 50th anniversary of the end of World War II.
properties.Image Text: The Indian National Army Monument tells an intriguing story of Singapore's past.

properties.Name: Reflections at Bukit Chandu: Singapore War Memorial
properties.description: Reflections at Bukit Chandu relives the Battle of Pasir Panjang, one of the fiercest battles fought against the Japanese in Singapore during World War II.
properties.Opening Hours: Tuesday to Sunday, 9am – 5.30pm,Closed on Monday (except on public holidays)
properties.Image Text: Reflections at Bukit Chandu is housed in a lovingly restored colonial bungalow.

properties.Name: Sri Veeramakaliamman Temple: Hindu Temple in Singapore
properties.description: Sri Veeramakaliamman Temple is one of Singapore’s oldest Hindu temples, in the heart of Little India.
properties.Image Text: The Sri Veeramakaliamman Temple is a distinctive landmark in the heart of Little India.

properties.Name: Sultan Mosque (Masjid Sultan) Singapore
properties.description: The impressive Sultan Mosque (also known as Masjid Sultan) in historic Kampong Glam is the focal point for Singapore’s Muslim community.

properties.Name: ArtScience Museum Singapore
properties.description: Catch world-class touring exhibitions at the ArtScience Museum at Marina Bay Sands.
properties.Image Text: The ArtScience Museum in Singapore hosts a variety of international touring exhibitions.

properties.Name: Changi Museum Singapore
properties.description: Changi Museum provides an emotional exploration of Singapore’s wartime history during the Japanese Occupation.
properties.Image Text: Explore our wartime past by learning about the Fall of Singapore and the infamous Changi Prison.

properties.Name: MINT Museum of Toys Singapore & Toy Museum
properties.description: Singapore's MINT Museum of Toys' vast collection of vintage toys will delight both kids and adults.
properties.Image Text: More than 50,000 vintage toys from as many as 40 countries are on display at this Singapore toy museum.

properties.Name: Red Dot Design Museum, Singapore
properties.description: The Red Dot Design Museum holds more than 1,000 products and items that are winners for their good design.
properties.Opening Hours: Monday - Friday, 11am – 6 pm, Saturday and Sunday, 11am – 8 pm
properties.Image Text: Award-winning exhibits at the Red Dot Design Museum in Singapore are sure to delight design fans.

properties.Name: NUS University Museum, Singapore
properties.description: Get a deeper insight into Asian art and artefacts at NUS Museum at Singapore’s leading university.
properties.ADDRESSSTREETNAME: 50 Kent Ridge Crescent, National University of Singapore
properties.Image Text: The NUS Museum in Singapore houses more than 8,000 exhibits that take you back to the past.

properties.Name: River Safari Singapore
properties.description: The River Safari Singapore is a fascinating new wildlife park that recreates life in and around the world’s rivers.
properties.Image Text: Meet manatees, monkeys and more as you ride the world's rivers at River Safari, Singapore.

properties.Name: Little India Singapore: History & Culture
properties.description: Little India is a buzzing historic district that shows off the best of Singapore’s Indian community, from vibrant culture to ethnic-inspired shopping.
properties.Image Text: Immerse yourself in the rich culture of Little India, Singapore.

properties.Name: Orchard Road, Singapore: Asia's Most Famous Shopping Street
properties.description: Don’t miss a trip to Orchard Road. Asia’s most famous shopping street is home to fashion favourites, specialist stores and loads of other lifestyle choices.
properties.Image Text: Orchard Road, Singapore is nothing short of a shopper's paradise.

properties.Name: Gardens by the Bay
properties.description: Gardens by the Bay provides mesmerising waterfront views across three gardens, spanning over 101 hectares of reclaimed land.
properties.Opening Hours: Bay South Outdoor Gardens Daily, 5am - 2am Cooled Conservatories and OCBC Skyway Daily, 9am - 9pm(last ticket sale at 8pm).Far East Organization Children's Garden Tuesday* to Friday, 10am - 7pm(last admission: 6.30pm)*Closed on Tuesday if a public holiday falls on the preceding Monday Weekends and public holidays, 9am - 9pm(last admission: 8.30pm)
properties.Image Text: Be mesmerised by stunning waterfront views at the award-winning horticultural destination that is Gardens by the Bay.

properties.Name: Bras Basah.Bugis, Singapore Cultural District
properties.description: The Bras Basah.Bugis Precinct is the vibrant arts and cultural district in the heart of Singapore's civic centre, and home to top museums and monuments.
properties.Image Text: There’s nowhere else quite like shopping at Bugis.

properties.Name: Marina Bay Sands®
properties.description: Superlatives naturally spring to mind when beholding Marina Bay Sands®. Its bold, swooping curves, steep slopes, and soaring spaces defy gravity and evoke awe.
properties.Opening Hours: SkyPark<sup® Operating Hours - Monday to Thursday, 9:30am – 10pm, Friday to Sunday, 9:30am – 11pm, Shoppes Daily, 10am – 10pm (hours vary by store)
properties.Image Text: The breathtaking Marina Bay Sands is a sheer modern architectural triumph.

properties.Name: Labrador Nature Reserve
properties.description: With its rich biodiversity and war relics, nature lovers and history enthusiasts will find plenty to do at Labrador Nature Reserve.
properties.Image Text: Labrador Nature Reserve in Singapore is a beautiful park that is rich with biodiversity.

properties.Name: Marina Bay Sands, Singapore
properties.description: Marina Bay Sands® boasts luxury accommodations, upscale shopping and an infinity pool with unparalleled views of the city.
properties.Opening Hours: Opening hours varies. Please visit the official website for more information.

properties.Name: Singapore Garden & Singapore Park
properties.description: The Southern Ridges is a 10-km stretch of connecting trails which lets you walk among the trees to observe a wide variety of flora and fauna in their natural habitat.
properties.ADDRESSSTREETNAME: Henderson Road, Mount Faber Park, Telok Blangah Hill Park
properties.Image Text: From world-class theme parks to celebrity restaurants, Resorts World Sentosa has it all.

properties.Name: Joo Chiat/Katong: Singapore Peranakan Neighbourhood
properties.description: Discover Peranakan culture as you stroll past heritage shophouses, quaint stores and eateries in Joo Chiat/Katong, a charming corner of eastern Singapore.
properties.Image Text: Spend a day exploring heritage shophouses and quaint stores at Joo Chiat/Katong.

properties.Name: Sentosa Island, Singapore: Leisure & Attractions
properties.description: Sentosa Island is Singapore’s favourite leisure destination, with more than 500 hectares filled with exciting attractions, golden beaches, luxe retreats and the country’s first integrated resort, Resorts World Sentosa.
properties.Image Text: Get ready for laughs, thrills and loads of fun in the sun at Sentosa Island.

properties.Name: Singapore Science Centre
properties.description: Singapore Science Centre holds the largest collection of educational materials devoted to science in the country.
properties.Opening Hours: Science Centre Singapore Daily, 10am – 6pm(last admission: 5.15pm) .Omni Theatre Daily, 12pm – 6pm (last show: 6pm) . Snow City Daily, 10am – 6pm (last admission: 5pm) School and public holidays, 10am – 7pm (last admission: 6pm)
properties.Image Text: Adults and kids of all ages who are not even science buffs will have fun at the Singapore Science Centre.

properties.Name: Fort Canning Park
properties.description: Whether you’re a history buff, music fan or nature lover, this historic Fort Canning Park has something for everyone.
properties.ADDRESSSTREETNAME: Bounded by Hill Street, Canning Rise, Clemenceau Avenue and River Valley Road
properties.Image Text: Take a stroll back in time at Fort Canning Park, Singapore - a landmark full of history.

properties.Name: Jurong Bird Park, Singapore: Attractions & Things to Do
properties.description: Jurong Bird Park has almost every species to impress avian lovers, along with fun exhibits, interactive shows, and of course, its charming residents.
properties.Image Text: Enjoy close encounters with some of our prettiest and rarest feathered friends at the Jurong Bird Park.

properties.Name: Lasalle College of the Arts
properties.description: How can something that fits so perfectly into a cityscape evoke nature as well? It all lies in the design of Lasalle College of the Arts.
properties.Opening Hours: Administration Office Monday to Friday, 9am – 6pm.Visitors can still walk around the campus after office opening hours.
properties.Image Text: Lasalle College of the Arts pushes the boundaries of creativity in architecture.
